page.title: 01The Royal Dee at Inver
page.content: The physical appearance of 'the block' described is that of a flat-bottomed valley with higher ground to either side (450m). It is traveled from east/west by the River Dee and the main road (A93) on the northern side of the river. The area is principally planted with conifers with farmland on valley floor growing small amounts of cattle foder with cattle and sheep in enclosed rough grazing. The open moorland is used for deer stalking and grouse shooting. This rural area is sparsely populated and those living here find employment as tenant farmers or estate workers. The only amenity - the Inver Hotel - has a small passing trade from th thousands of touristthat drive throuh our picturesque ar during the summer months attracted by the villages Braemar to the west,Ballater to the east and of course Balmoral
